meanings.definition: To make something complete or whole.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours totalizing her puzzle, ensuring every piece fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The artist totalizing the painting by adding the final brushstrokes.
meanings.sent3: After totalizing the ingredients for the cake, she realized she forgot the flour!
meanings.sent4: His love for her was totalizing, filling every corner of his heart.
meanings.sent5: The sun totalizing the sky with its warm rays, painting it in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: To consider or treat something as a whole.
meanings.sent1: When writing an essay, it is important to totalize all your points in the conclusion.
meanings.sent2: The teacher totalized the class discussion by summarizing the main ideas.
meanings.sent3: He totalized the messy room as a treasure trove waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter totalized the room, spreading joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The chef totalized the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs, enhancing the flavors.

meanings.definition: To have a controlling influence over something.
meanings.sent1: The dictator totalized the country, imposing strict rules on its citizens.
meanings.sent2: The hypnotist totalized the audience, making them believe they were chickens.
meanings.sent3: The toddler totalized the household, demanding attention with every cry.
meanings.sent4: Fear totalized his mind, preventing him from taking any risks.
meanings.sent5: The storm totalized the landscape, reshaping it with its powerful winds.
